Title: Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Software Engineer.

In this role, you will:
Participate in projects associated with the technology domain, including installation, upgrades, and deployment efforts
Identify opportunity for service quality and availability within the technology domain environment
Review and analyze technical assignments or challenges that are related to low to medium risk deliverables and that require research, evaluation, and selection of alternative technology domains


At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.

Title: Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Human Resources Technology offers a unique opportunity to be an integral part of changes aimed at continuously improving the Team Member experience and furthering Wells Fargo's goal to be 'The Employer of Choice'. You will have the opportunity of working in a group of very dynamic and talented professionals primarily located in Charlotte, Des Moines, Minneapolis, and Phoenix, who are responsible for developing and supporting Wells Fargo's Talent Acquisition applications used by our 280,000 team members and 84 lines of business. Over time, you will have opportunities to work with many different applications and learn different facets of HR practices. When you are ready, we also offer you the ability to grow within the company, either within the Wells Fargo Technology group or another corporate or business function.

We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer that excels with Workday who will be responsible for the design and implementation of recruiting requirements to ensure the integrity and availability of the Workday/HR Systems. This is a hybrid work environment - working in the office and working from home.

Title: Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Information Security Engineer to perform Dynamic Application Security Testing as part of the Software Development Lifecycle. In this role, you will work with software development partners to identify and mitigate the security vulnerabilities in the applications identified through DAST in test environments. Communication with the business security team, enterprise security group, and development technology partners is critical in this role. You will also act as an application security SME for the development and security communities within Wells Fargo.

In this role, you will:
Conduct penetration testing / dynamic application security testing using both manual and automated testing tools.

$100,800 - $179,200 Annual

Title: Software Engineer
Job_Description:
The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Liquidity Risk Management (LRM) Technology team supports multiple Liquidity Risk Management requirements of Wells Fargo Treasury. LRM team sources data from over 60 upstream data sources/SORs to support Intraday Liquidity, Liquidity Analytics, Asset categorization, Operational deposits and IRR modeling, consolidation of financial data and various data sourcing and synthesizing to support several regulatory reporting (Fr2052a (aka 6G), LCR, RLAP, RLEN, FR Y-15 etc. LRM tech also provides tech build to support critical capabilities and financial crisis management for dynamic scenario forecasting, recovery and resolution options modeling.

Liquidity Risk Management Technology is seeking a Java Senior Software Engineer that acts in the mid-level technical role as an individual contributor for the most complex computer applications and/or application initiatives. Title: Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Within EFT the Corporate Risk Technology group helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas: credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.

We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer to be part of a team that provides modern web application development solutions to support the enterprise risk domain. The Lead Software Engineer will be responsible to design, code, test, debug and document programs using Java, Spring/Spring Boot framework technologies.



At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. Liquidity Risk Management (LRM) Technology team supports multiple Liquidity Risk Management requirements of Wells Fargo Treasury. LRM team sources data from over 60 upstream data sources/SORs to support Intraday Liquidity, Liquidity Analytics, Asset categorization, Operational deposits and IRR modeling, consolidation of financial data and various data sourcing and synthesizing to support several regulatory reporting (Fr2052a (aka 6G), LCR, RLAP, RLEN, FR Y-15 etc. LRM tech also provides tech build to support critical capabilities and financial crisis management for dynamic scenario forecasting, recovery and resolution options modeling.

Title: Lead Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Corporate Essbase Development Group (EDG) provides technology support and development for Corporate Finance, Corporate Finance Planning & Analysis (FP&A), and the broader finance community at Wells Fargo.

We are looking for a Full stack API developer (Lead Software Engineer) to help modernize existing applications that were developed using a variety of vendor tools. The ideal candidate must have extensive development experience with Java, JavaScript, Python, Node.js, as well as front-end frameworks such as Angular and REACT. In addition, they should know the installation, configuration, platform operations, and troubleshooting of API products. Besides, they should also have experience in API design, BaaS, Advanced proxies, Analytics, Developer Portal, and creating RESTful API patterns.

Title: Lead Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Information Security Engineer with extensive experience in incident response, network-focused forensics, and threat hunting. The ideal candidate will have a well-rounded background in endpoint/network defenses and security incident response, as well as some offensive security knowledge to allow the ability to think like an adversary. The candidate will also have experience partnering with content development teams to resolve gaps in detection capabilities, as well as experience in conducting technical research and identifying methods to detect evolving Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs).

This role will serve as an incident responder to assess the risk, impact, and scope of identified security threats, as well as leading the response efforts to include containment, eradication, and recovery. Strong verbal and written communication skills are desired, in order to ensure thorough and accurate reporting during and concluding a security incident. The candidate will also play a major role in detecting advanced threats that are not detected via traditional security tools and understand how to operationalize cyber threat intelligence. Regular collaboration with multiple teams such as the Cyber Threat Fusion Center, Security Content Development, Cyber Threat Intelligence, and Offensive Security Research teams will be critical to success.



At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. Wells Fargo is seeking a .Net Senior Software Engineer to join the Enterprise Functions Technology team accountable for Enterprise Cyber Security tools and support. This role will be responsible for the design, development, testing, documentation and analysis of .Net applications supporting various cyber hygiene efforts around vulnerabilities, patching, and remediation. Lead moderately complex initiatives and deliverables within technical domain environments
Contribute to large scale planning of strategies

Title: Lead Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Information Security Engineer with extensive experience in incident response, network-focused forensics, and threat hunting. The ideal candidate will have a well-rounded background in endpoint/network defenses and security incident response, as well as some offensive security knowledge to allow the ability to think like an adversary. The candidate will also have experience partnering with content development teams to resolve gaps in detection capabilities, as well as experience in conducting technical research and identifying methods to detect evolving Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs).

This role will serve as an incident responder to assess the risk, impact, and scope of identified security threats, as well as leading the response efforts to include containment, eradication, and recovery. Strong verbal and written communication skills are desired, in order to ensure thorough and accurate reporting during and concluding a security incident. The candidate will also play a major role in detecting advanced threats that are not detected via traditional security tools and understand how to operationalize cyber threat intelligence. Regular collaboration with multiple teams such as the Cyber Threat Fusion Center, Security Content Development, Cyber Threat Intelligence, and Offensive Security Research teams will be critical to success.



At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Title: Lead Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Principal Engineer who will be part of a technology led innovation at an enterprise scale to transform Telemetry, Monitoring and Observability for on-prem platforms, as well as private and public cloud.

Our vision is to deliver observability capabilities to customers for consumer grade insight at competitive price utilizing open source and open standards, while modernizing to reduce cost of failure, improve availability, and optimize software engineering capacity

In this role, you will:
Act as an advisor to leadership to develop or influence applications, network, information security, database, operating systems, or web technologies for highly complex business and technical needs across multiple groups
This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Title: Lead Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Within EFT the Corporate Risk Technology group helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas: credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.

We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer to be part of a team that provides modern web application development solutions to support the enterprise risk domain. The Lead Software Engineer will be responsible to design, code, test, debug and document programs using Java, Spring/Spring Boot framework technologies.

Title: Lead Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Systems Operations Engineer in Technology Architect and Engineering as part of Technology . Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com .

In this role, you will:
Participate in complex technical issues and initiatives related to large scale applications, systems, databases, or other technical products and services
Identify opportunity for process improvements within technical support strategies and plans
Review and analyze technical queries to extract data, create standard databases, or perform limited programming to fine tune systems supporting low to medium risk technical deliverables
@RWF22



MINNEAPOLIS. MN

CHANDLER, AZ

CHARLOTTE, NC

EL MONTE, CA

SAN FRANCISCO, CA

In this position you will be asked to provide support for Wholesale Digital & Transformational Technology (WDTT) applications as an Systems Operations Engineer on the Platform Management Team across the portfolio. The focus will be to drive incident management, triage and troubleshooting in addition to aiding in improving overall system stability and reduce Mean Time To Recovery (MTTR), enable High Availability and improve Disaster Recovery. In addition proactively identifying troublesome trends as they develop; analyze/predict trends, implement effective monitoring/alerting and develop a long-range plan designed to resolve problems and prevent them from recurring; maintains high service levels for the IT community. Direct the daily Risk and Control flow of operations, focusing on policies, procedures, and work standards to ensure success; re-engineering and driving continual service improvement.

Job seekers must meet Basic Qualifications to be considered qualified and eligible applicants. - Excellent verbal and written communication skills. - Background in one or more infrastructure or application technologies. - Strong problem solving skills.

Preferred Skills: - Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent experience - Strong analytical skills with both detail and big-picture processing - Self-motivated, well organized with strong innovation, infrastructure knowledge and development skills - Proven oral and written communication skills; excellent business presentation skills

Title: Data Management Product Designer - Principal Data Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Title: Senior Project Designer
Location: San Francisco, CA
Duration: 6 months
Benefits on offer for this contract position: Health Insurance, Life insurance, 401K and Voluntary Benefits

Summary:
Act as an advisor to senior leadership to develop or influence objectives, plans, specifications, resources, and long-term goals for highly complex business and technical needs across Product Design. Lead the strategy and resolution of highly complex and unique challenges requiring in-depth evaluation across Product Design or the enterprise, delivering solutions that are long-term, large-scale and require vision, creativity, innovation, advanced analytical and inductive thinking, and coordination of highly complex activities and guidance to others. Provide vision, direction and expertise to senior leadership on implementing innovative and significant business solutions that are large-scale cross-functional or enterprise-wide strategies. Strategically engage with all levels of professionals and managers across the enterprise and serve as an expert advisor to Product Design leadership.

Title: Data Management Product Designer - Principal Data Management Analyst
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is looking for an experienced UX writer or technology content strategist with a strong background in client management, business processes, and design thinking. You have a portfolio of work with content that enhances and simplifies the overall user experience, maybe even some examples of interactive/conversational copy. You have worked with, or as, a UX/UI designer, developing creative visual storytelling to accompany copy.

The Conversational Experience Designers (CED) work on enterprise conversational AI platform deploying cognitive software agent who listens and interacts with people to solve problems. The software agent reads natural language, understands context, applies logic, infers user intention, learns through experience and senses emotions. Depending on the customer journey, Conversation Experience Designers may be involved in all aspects of the lifecycle: from blank canvas possibilities through concept prototyping to discovery, implementation, and maturation. Successful CEDs are comfortable with the unexpected, never losing enthusiasm or a keen determination to produce results.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Management Product Designer - Principal Data Management Analyst
Job_Description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our clients at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Experience Design at Wells Fargo

Our Vision: Bring more joy to people's digital relationship with their money.

Our Mission: We design experiences with joy at their core to build brand love, trust and loyalty.

As part of the Experience design team at Wells Fargo, you will be fueled by exceptional thought leadership, subject matter experts and world class talent.



At Wells Fargo Advisors, you won't be a cog in a machine, you'll help drive innovation by collaborating with a dedicated team who builds user experiences and digital products for millions of clients.

The Strategy, Digital and Innovation (SDI) team forges the strategic direction of Wells Fargo, provides and manages our digital foundation and common capabilities, and transforms our business models to meet evolving customer needs and grow the company. The investments we are making will help the company create innovative digital banking experiences, and make it easier for customers to achieve their financial goals.

We're looking for more than a writer. We're seeking a creative client advocate with a keen eye for detail and a deep understanding of the ways copy helps clients achieve their objectives. Ideal candidates are not only amazing writers, but also creative collaborators, analytical thinkers, zealous self-starters, and detail-oriented editors who work well in complex environments.

As part of Wells Fargo Experience Design, the Senior Content Designer will contribute to a wide range of projects; from helping to shape brand new digital tools to optimizing existing pages, flows and widgets. We're looking for someone who collaborates with product owners and designers to create engaging, clear, concise yet conversational copy that makes digital investing simpler.

This position is subject to FINRA Background Screening Requirements, including successful completion and clearing of a background check. Internal transfers are subject to comply with 17 CRF 240.17f-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and FINRA Bylaws, Article III, Section 3, which states that Associated Persons should not be subject to statutory disqualification. Successful candidates must also meet ongoing regulatory requirements including additional screening and are required to report certain incidents.

Facilitate the scrum process with cross functional impact that involve moderately complex projects, non projects, or maintenance work
Guide the scrum teams to follow Agile and Scrum practices to actively promote prioritization, team readiness, and commitment for each Sprint
Optimize scrum team velocity to identify improvement opportunities to achieve higher levels of team performance

Title: Senior Scrum Master
Job_Description:
About this role:

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Compliance, Legal, Audit & Regulatory Technology (CLAR) provides technology support and development for Legal & Data Controls, Compliance Risk & Audit, Financial Crimes, Front Office and Second Line Risk, Employee Compliance, Regulator Regulations, Market Surveillance, and Regulator Change Management.

This role will provide a centralized agile program management across the various solution created by Regulatory & Policy Affairs and Financial Crimes KYC Technology department. The combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed. We are seeking a Software Engineering Manager to lead the team of Scrum Masters that support our various Product development teams.

Title: Senior Scrum Master
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Project Manager who will have the responsibility for managing complex change work for product area(s) within the Human Resources Portfolio Delivery Team . They will develop and communicate the product's vision to be fulfilled by their agile team and will work with both internal and external stakeholders to represent the voice of the business.

In this role, you will:
Act as an advisor to leadership to develop or influence success of programs, project performance and prioritization for planning, communications, and engagements across change management
Lead the strategy and resolution of highly complex and unique challenges requiring full understanding of project impacts and comprehensive engagement.
:

The Project Manager will organize and lead initiatives to ensure that data quality is maintained so that data can effectively support business processes. Partner with groups and various levels of seniority companywide to coordinate and drive collaboration on solution design and remediation execution.

Job_Description:
Title: Lead Scrum Master
Location: Charlotte, NC, Minneapolis, MN, Dallas, TX, Summit, NJ,
Duration: 18 months
Benefits on offer for this contract position: Health Insurance, Life insurance, 401K and Voluntary Benefits

Summary:
Manage and develop Scaled Agile portfolios of the highest complexity. Guide the teams to follow Agile and Scrum practices to promote prioritization, team readiness, and commitment for each Sprint. Optimize scrum team velocity to identify improvement opportunities to achieve higher levels of team performance. Oversee systemic impediments to team agility and guide the teams on methods to escalate. Deliver capabilities using agile practices while following the Software Development Lifecycle, business process mapping, and various release processes to ensure all risk, security, and development requirements are met. Partner with discipline managers to convey their concerns to scrum teams about governance policies and adherence to corporate standards. Collaborate with product owners, program or project managers to communicate delivery of work product from the teams and escalate key risks and issues impeding scrum team effectiveness. Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues and managers to resolve issues and achieve goals. Interact with internal customers. Receive direction from leaders and exercise independent judgment while developing the knowledge to understand function, policies, procedures, and compliance requirements. Train other Scrum Masters and serve as a mentor to less experienced staff.

Title: Senior Information Security Analyst (CTFC)
Job_Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Summary:
The Vulnerability Operations team is a governance team aligned to the Technology Infrastructure and Information Security organizations at Wells Fargo. The team provides oversight of outstanding enterprise-wide software vulnerabilities and facilitates their rapid research and subsequent closure. The team also owns and executes enterprise risk management controls and maintains documentation and evidence sufficient to provide adequate defense in annual internal audits and possible regulatory scrutiny.

This particular role is responsible for helping to ensure actions from our team remain on track by building a Jira-based service desk and overseeing intake, prioritization, and delivery of solutions for known issues, required deliverables, and other actions which will be submitted into the service desk and need oversight to ensure successful, on-time completion. This role will have a particular focus on helping to respond or drive response to audit and risk management deliverables such as RCSA and control reviews.

The role requires strong spreadsheet analysis skills, strong Jira skills, strong communication and facilitation skills, a cool head under pressure, and a collaborative, encouraging spirit with a sense of humor.

Description:
Seeking a proactive, independent team member with superb attention to detail to help a risk governance team to deliver on its mission. The successful candidate will be a go-getter who takes charge and leads assigned work boldly without concern for who needs to be engaged to get results.

Develop an understanding of incoming work, identify the affected parties, communicate action needed concisely, and work with the teams to track the deliverables until done, escalating when deliverables are missed, and working with teams in whatever granularity needed to bring the work back on track with an appropriate sense of urgency. Analyze demand and capacity constraints of the team to identify efforts / or work items in jeopardy and craft communications and reports which provide transparency into progress and insight into problems or actions needed by leaders. Success is based on proactive escalation and visibility into items at risk or experiencing active issues and your efforts to resolve challenges.
Lead meetings to review outstanding items and capture status or impediments to forward action. Engage necessary parties to resolve impediments and to keep work moving, or escalate to manager for support.

This team is not Agile, and a move to Agile is not in scope for this role. The successful candidate: (1) will manage pressure well. This is not a constantly high pressure job, but there are deadlines, and we must remain on track. (2) will take ownership of assigned work and execute in line with documented procedure, (3) will communicate extremely clearly in writing and on the phone; virtually 100% of the job is via phone or email with people in other locations. Communication is critical. (4) will maintain a professional and friendly demeanor at all times, (5) will see this role as an opportunity to demonstrate servant leadership in action, (6) will be self-motivated and will look for ways to add value beyond the letter of the assignment, (7) will find a way to clarify and simplify complicated scenarios for leadership decision and quick understanding.

Key points:

Other:

Wells Fargo's Corporate Asset Liability Management Group (ALM) is looking for a highly motivated individual with financial analysis skills, knowledge of bank funding and experience in the areas of balance sheet analysis and financial forecasting. The individual will play an important role in the Corporate ALM team with responsibility for the ALM funding forecast and interest rate risk analysis.

The ALM Group performs a wide range of highly complex quantitative analyses of the Company's balance sheet forecast for financial forecasting and interest rate risk management. Team members are responsible for partnering across Treasury, Corporate Finance and business unit subject matter experts to generate financial forecasts for ALM purposes and provide management with insights concerning the balance sheet forecast across a wide range of baseline, stress and interest rate risk scenarios. This position provides a unique opportunity to gain an understanding of Wells Fargo's balance sheet and add value to the Company's capital, liquidity, and interest rate analytics and reporting while building partnerships across Finance.

About this role:

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Enterprise Service Management (ESM) is a new organization in EFT which represents the integration of the ServiceNow delivery team, IT data, and Governance to provide an unmatched, industry-leading experience for customers and employees alike. ESM's vision is to empower our teams to work smarter, faster, and more consistently through efficient process, reusable capabilities, and trusted data. The vision will be accomplished by focusing on the following four priorities:

1. Reliable, stable platform for day-to-day use

2. Trusted data  architected, managed, and governed

3. Value realization though out-of-the-box implementation

4. Increased efficiency and effectiveness resulting in an improved employee experience

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Technology Business Systems Consultant who will be responsible for the execution of a ServiceNow data governance and quality framework in alignment with enterprise and IT data governance policies and standards. They will work with team of data engineers and business analysts accountable for executing the data governance and quality roadmap.

Title: Senior Information Security Analyst (CTFC)
Job_Description:
Job#: 1307509

Job Description:
IAM Access Monitoring team supporting Access monitoring across Windows, Mainframe, Database, Azure Cloud and Google Cloud platforms.

Daily Responsibilities:
Provide daily monitoring of privileged access activities across the Wells Fargo database environments using internal Splunk and Cloud SIEM solutions;
Enforce Wells Fargo privileged access security policies, standards and risk controls;
Escalation of access activities that dont align with Wells Fargo controls or industry best practices;


Provide advanced information security consultation for all aspects of information security compliance policy, risk management, and remediation. Direct information security risk assessment and research, and recommend remediation plans and strategies. Influence stakeholders on net new or on material changes to an asset to influence control decisions. Provide consulting on security risk assessment and research, and recommend remediation plans and strategies. Act as more experienced lead to the organization to develop security risk awareness and mitigating actions. Consult the organization on complex security issues and findings. Manage the most complex and critical information assets. Evaluate and interpret internal and companywide information security policies, processes, standards, and participate with more experienced leaders in decision making on information security. Serve as information security lead to advise on the development and delivery of Information Security Education and Awareness. Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and mid-level to more experienced managers to resolve issues and achieve goals. Lead projects and teams. Coordinate with vendor manager on third party assets to manage information security risks. Serve as a mentor to less experienced staff. Required Qualifications: 5+ years of Information Security Analysis experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education.

The State Bar of California is seeking a Fiscal Services Specialist to join their Accounts Receivable team. Applicants must have demonstrated understanding of AP and AR. Candidate will be responsible for cash receipts reconciliation, desktop deposits, and processing incoming payments for all departments in the State Bar. Candidate will be responsible for various billing and collections activities including posting licensee bar dues and processing incoming discipline payments. In addition, candidate will be responsible for AR unclaimed property. Experience with Oracle Fusion, Wells Fargo CEO Portal, and excel is helpful. This hybrid role can allow for up to two days of remote work per week depending on business need.
DEFINITION
The Fiscal Services Specialist is responsible for performing a variety of finance and budgeting functions and transactions including but not limited to preparing, processing, analyzing, interpreting, reconciling, maintaining and verifying the correctness of a variety of finance and budgeting data, records and reports related to accounts payable, accounts receivable, disbursement, member billing, payroll, attorney/client trust accounts, collection, budgeting, and financial reporting activities; responds to inquiries from State Bar members, employees and outside agencies, including vendors, tax authorities and banks. The Fiscal Services Specialist also provides support for other accounting and administrative functions within the Office of Finance and may be assigned to one or more specialized area.

This position within the FTS (File Transmission Services) group will be responsible for file transmission management activities involving internal and external customers for a large Managed File Transfer (MFT) platform. The right candidate will have solid experience with MFT applications, UNIX/Linux systems, a thorough understanding of TCP/IP networks, PKI, API, SSH, TLS, and must be security-minded. Additionally, application development skills are desired along with familiarity with a variety of scripting languages. Exposure to Jira and Agile methodologies a plus. The candidate should be able to analyze business workflow and recommend improvements while having a risk, compliance, & governance-based mindset.

Looking for candidates with a background involving file transmission tools and protocols, MFT applications, advanced knowledge of SFTP, FTPS, HTTPS, AS2, NDM setups and troubleshooting. Exposure to file transmission clients and libraries such as OpenSSH, OpenSSL, Axway, IBM Sterling etc. Experience digesting detailed log files either manually or via an application such as Splunk. Comfortable discussing and explaining technical information over email and phone in a professional manner. Position will at least begin in a hybrid remote model with two days home and three in the office, candidate will require the ability to work from home in a quiet environment with consistent internet connectivity.

Job_Description:
The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Risk Technology (RT) helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.

Title: Senior Systems Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Systems Operations Engineer...

Accessibility is a key part of Wells Fargo's mission to empower all people and organizations to achieve more. Our internal assistive technology support team partners with multiple lines of business across the enterprise to make that vision a reality for people with different abilities. As part of this focus we are looking for a solution-oriented Accessibility Specialist with a strong background and knowledge of assistive technologies, accessibility and customer issue remediation. Are you passionate about improving the user experience of people using assistive technology? Are you able to assist others who have less experience in accessibility to maximize the functionality of their assistive technology software/hardware? Are you a technical, experienced professional capable of managing customer feedback and issues to improve accessibility across Wells Fargo? Do you possess strong organizational skills, excellent communication skills, and have a provable track record of juggling multiple issues simultaneously? Then read on!

General Responsibilities

We are looking for an Accessibility/Assistive Technology Specialist that will assist Wells Fargo team members in resolving accessibility issues that they may have with their assistive technology hardware/software, along with advocating for improved user experiences in our products and services to positively affect user experiences. The ideal candidate will have a wide range of skills and understanding for all aspects of disability, including visual, mobility, hearing, cognitive, and speech impairments, and how accessibility can drive improvements to the overall user experience.



At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Title: AI/ML CoE Employee Experience & Collaboration Lead
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Lead Artificial Intelligence Solutions Consultant.

Are you passionate about helping data scientists by building capabilities and solutions leveraging the state-of-the-art AI/ML tools on hybrid cloud platforms?

The Enterprise Analytics and Data Science (EADS) organization is looking for an expert AI/ML product design specialist to join our team and help us design AI/ML solutions and capabilities.

This team is part of the AI COE and is responsible for the ideation and delivery of AI and ML platform and data engineering solutions centered around consumer, commercial and enterprise functions for the bank.

As part of our CoE, we invest in you and your career. In addition to Wells Fargo benefits you may be eligible for, you'll have access to elite training platforms like O'Reilly and DataCamp, where you can learn from industry leading experts, along with many other internal and external subject specific education opportunities. Our diverse data science team ranges from university professors and experienced practitioners to data scientists new to the industry, creating a full spectrum of thought leadership and solution design. You'll be part of a team where there is room to grow, learn, contribute and participate in work being done on world class distributed computing platforms with the latest AI ML framework, both Open Source and licensed, that ultimately supports our customers and company. Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Software Engineer in the role of a ReactJS Developer within its Risk Model Development and Forecasting platform technology team.

Description:

At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure; provides information security; and enables Wells Fargo global customers to have 24 hours a day, 7 days a week banking access through in-branch, online, ATMs, and other channels.

Our mission is to deliver stable, secure, scalable, and innovative services at speeds that delight and satisfy our customers and unleash the skills potential of our employees.

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Within EFT the Corporate Risk Technology (CRT) group helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas: credit risk, operational risk, and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.

The Calculation Services group in Corporate Risk Technology is seeking a Lead Front End Engineer (Lead Software Engineer) to work on building and supporting a platform that runs and monitors qualitative and quantitative risk models for multiple lines of businesses. This position will provide an opportunity to build responsive user interfaces and dashboards with ReactJS that integrate with Python and Big Data services.

We make extensive us of use Spark, Rest API's, Django, Django DRF, React JS to develop and maintain an extensive SDK and Framework to enable self-service development, deployment, and end to end Batch and Real time Forecasting solutions available to our business. While we focus on integrating with Open-Source Apache and Linux Foundation AI & Data products, we also integrate with the latest commercial solutions like AtScale, Dremio, H2O.AI, Tableau and more through an API first integration strategy.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumens network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.
The Role
The Network Implementation Engineer II will be required to perform both, Engineering and Construction Project Administrator (CPA) functions for this area. Engineering requires evaluating, planning and designing network build solutions with approved technology and architecture, and issuing the projects to Construction. The Engineer will coordinate with developers and builders for new development, meet with government entities for preservation road project/infrastructure work, and work closely with Operations for rehab and maintenance issues and resolve held service orders for their area. Will be required to analyze available inventory and submit permits using company systems and records. The Engineer will work with Edge Planning on projects and utilize contract engineering as needed. The Engineer will be responsible for CWIP and closure of all their projects in a timely manner. SiteTracker system will be used for all facets of job duties. In addition to Engineering, will be responsible for CPA functions for wire centers, including Ethernet/CDFS projects. The CPA duties will include coordinating, scheduling and inspecting all placement and splicing activities with the local LE contractor, meeting service dates, ensuring a quality product to Lumen and paying the vendor.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Information Security Engineer with extensive experience in incident response, network-focused forensics, and threat hunting. The ideal candidate will have a well-rounded background in endpoint/network defenses and security incident response, as well as some offensive security knowledge to allow the ability to think like an adversary. The candidate will also have experience partnering with content development teams to resolve gaps in detection capabilities, as well as experience in conducting technical research and identifying methods to detect evolving Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs).

This role will serve as an incident responder to assess the risk, impact, and scope of identified security threats, as well as leading the response efforts to include containment, eradication, and recovery. Strong verbal and written communication skills are desired, in order to ensure thorough and accurate reporting during and concluding a security incident. The candidate will also play a major role in detecting advanced threats that are not detected via traditional security tools and understand how to operationalize cyber threat intelligence. Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Job#: 1307089

Job Description:
Location: Chandler AZ, Charlotte NC, Minneapolis MN (hybrid schedule onsite)- 3 days a week

Top 3 requirements:
5+ years of information security applications and/or systems experience
5+ years of Linux Server/OS admin/support experience-windows
3+ years of experience with cryptographic technologies - encryption key management and/or PKI (Public Key Infrastructure)
Intermediate to advanced experience and deep understanding of networking and network technologies
Intermediate to advanced experience with Bash shell scripting
Advanced problem solving and technical troubleshooting capabilities

Crypto discovery- scanning and reporting of files in windows and linux (would like to have both)- understanding artifacts in the environment- onprem

Join an exciting, fast-paced Team working with cutting edge Cryptographic related technologies. This position is part of the Cryptographic Engineering Team and will work alongside multiple Senior/Lead Information Security Engineers and with our Cryptographic Discovery and Agility Platform (CDAP) project team. The position will be responsible for completing engineering tasks associated with the production readiness and ongoing management and operation of the Wells Fargo Cryptographic Discovery/Agility Platform (CDAP). CDAP will be critical to gaining greater visibility/inventory/management capabilities for our entire cryptographic ecosystem and the various cryptographic artifacts used to secure and protect sensitive company and customer information. CDAP will also be leveraged as an integral part of the companies preparedness for Post Quantum Cryptography (PQC).


Lead computer security incident response activities for highly complex events. Conduct technical investigation of security related incidents and post incident digital forensics to identify causes and recommend future mitigation strategies. Provide security consulting on large projects for internal clients to ensure conformity with corporate information, security policy, and standards. Design, document, test, maintain, and provide issue resolution recommendations for highly complex security solutions related to networking, cryptography, cloud, authentication and directory services, email, internet, applications, and endpoint security. Review and correlate security logs. Utilize subject matter knowledge in industry leading security solutions and best practices to implement one or more components of information security such as availability, integrity, confidentiality, risk management, threat identification, modeling, monitoring, incident response, access management, and business continuity. Identify security vulnerabilities and issues, perform risk assessments, and evaluate remediation alternatives. Collaborate and influence all levels of professionals including managers. Lead a team to achieve objectives.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
The City of Moorhead is accepting applications for CAD Manager working in the Engineering Department. This administrative position performs difficult work performing advanced AutoCAD management. The CAD Manager provides leadership to a team of drafters and designers and coordinates with engineers to ensure project development accuracy. This position manages and develops AutoCAD Civil 3D procedures, standards and details to ensure department software, programs, techniques and tools are current. Works with department leadership regarding technical support, training and other CAD applications and standards. Monitors team members for technical skills, performance and productivity. The CAD Manager also performs quantitative research, drafting plans, preparing maps, calculating and recording data and quantities, performing algebraic and geometric design computations, and utilizes AutoCAD Civil 3D software. This position's primary duty is the performance of office or non-manual work directly related to the management and daily operation of the City Engineering Department. This position exercises lead work responsibilities as directed.

The essential functions of the position include, but are not limited to the following major duties performed. Duties are listed from most to least important.

Requirements

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ABILITIES
The CAD Manager requires thorough knowledge of AutoCAD including applications, best practices, management, development and implementation of AutoCAD standards, template and tool palette creation, updates and new releases; thorough knowledge of AutoCAD Civil 3D plan production and; thorough knowledge of PC-based computing skills and experience (word processing, spreadsheet, database management etc.); general knowledge of surveying and civil engineering principles, procedures, practices and techniques; general knowledge of engineering maps and records; general knowledge of city, state and federal policies, laws and regulations; ability to interpret operating, maintenance, technical and procedure manuals and engineering plans and specifications; ability to work closely with multiple engineers & designers to perform civil engineering design such as site layout, grading, erosion control, road profiles, corridors, pipe networks, utility plans, etc. Experience and exceptional proficiency with AutoCAD/Civil 3D plan production required; exceptional understanding of AutoCAD applications and best practices; Extensive experience in CAD management, including development and implementation of AutoCAD standards, template and tool palette creation, updates and new releases; Efficient and accurate in the use of the AutoCAD software to generate Engineering drawings; Ability to work well with others and able to adhere to and/or provide directions as needed. Ability to maintain a positive working relationship within all levels of the department. Ability to effectively communicate with management, project managers, peers and clients verbally and in writing. Extensive knowledge of PC-based computing skills and experience in word processing, spreadsheet, database management etc. Microsoft Office products proficiency; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with associates, supervisors, other departments, vendors and the general public.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS and WORKING CONDITIONS
The CAD Manager requires the occasional exertion of up to 25 pounds of force; work regularly requires standing, walking, sitting, speaking or hearing and repetitive motions, frequently requires using hands to finger, handle or feel, stooping, kneeling, crouching or crawling, reaching with hands and arms, and lifting and occasionally requires climbing or balancing, tasting or smelling and pushing or pulling; work has standard vision requirements; vocal communication is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word and conveying detailed or important instructions accurately, loudly or quickly; hearing is required to perceive information at normal spoken word levels and to receive detailed information through oral communications and/or to make fine distinctions in sound; work requires preparing and analyzing written or computer data, visual inspection involving small defects and/or small parts, using of measuring devices, operating machines, operating motor vehicles or equipment and observing general surroundings and activities; work regularly requires working near moving mechanical parts and exposure to outdoor weather conditions, frequently requires working in high, precarious places and exposure to toxic or caustic chemicals and exposure to the risk of electrical shock; work is generally in a loud noise location (e.g. grounds maintenance, heavy traffic).

The City of Moorhead offers a positive, friendly and collaborative work environment that is team focused where everyone is working together to serve our community. Our employees are passionate about their jobs and making our community one to be proud of. We are #MoorheadProud

The City of Moorhead is an equal opportunity employer and a proud employer located in the metropolitan region of Fargo-Moorhead

Title: Senior Institutional Investment Operations Specialist
Job_Description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

About this role:

Risk Architecture, a unit under Market and Counterparty Risk Management (MCRM), is the first line of support for CoRS, the risk aggregation system for the enterprise. This position for the Risk Architecture team will assist with the development of business stories for the integration of projects or other change items defined for CoRS, perform daily platform oversight, and constantly interaction with multiple lines of businesses and technology teams to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of the platform information. This position will be responsible for working with inquiries from multiple lines of businesses, multiple front-line desks and marketers and the credit administration group to answer daily questions and help architect systematic solutions for new prioritized projects that align with the risk management framework and vision for MCRM. These solutions should be constructed using modern functionality to maintain the agility of the platform and meet the service level requirements and accuracy demands required for elevated risk management. Daily tasks include the identification, measurement, aggregation, approval, pricing, exposure explanations and research and reporting of risk.

The successful candidate will be familiar with Loan and Fixed Income Trading products including, but not limited to: Loans, Syndicated Loans, Derivatives, Foreign Exchange, Securities Trading and Securities Financing. This individual will have some familiarity with various Wells Fargo lines of business SOR's (ie. AFS, Loan IQ, Calypso, GMI, Broadridge and other trading platforms) and possess the aptitude to understand complex business concepts while being integral to the design, development, and implementation of risk-based solutions. Experience working with product risk models and risk calculation methodologies is desired. Conducting hands on training and writing training materials for new system functionality, process mapping new workflow processes, creating informational system release notes, and maintaining outbound file documentation and field level definitions will be part of the daily responsibilities. This position will also require an individual who is prepared to work on multiple projects, technology releases, and daily tasks all at the same time. Attention to detail, the ability to translate technical and business specifications into risk terminology and the ability to traverse between Risk, Credit, Technical and Front Office business units is essential.

Title: Senior Institutional Investment Operations Specialist
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Quantitative Analytics Specialist within its Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning (ML) Center of Excellence group.

The AI and ML CoE team in Enterprise Analytics and Data Science (EADS) is responsible for developing and deploying NLP, machine learning, and AI solutions for key strategic Enterprise initiatives such as customer experience improvement, risk management and compliance, business operational excellence, and team member experience. The team is looking for an experienced analytics professional to add to its AI/ML/NLP model development team for Internal Audit.

As part of the AI/ML/NLP data science team for Internal Audit model development, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing AI/ML models focusing on Internal Audit initiatives for the enterprise and Wells Fargo lines of business. You will be leveraging unstructured text such as emails, text messages, notes, and semi-structured data in combination of structured data to apply text analytics and AI/NLP/ML techniques. You will use open stack programming languages (primarily Python) and/or vendor solutions to develop models and deploy them on Wells Fargo's AI platform. The ideal candidate should be able to think outside the box to uncover new ways to analyze unstructured data in conjunction with analytical tools to answer complicated business questions. As part of the model development team, you will be responsible of delivering solutions that meet business needs as well as any efforts related to model documentation and reviews to ensure the modeling processes and procedures meet corporate model risk policies and requirements.

The State Bar of California is seeking a Fiscal Services Specialist to join their Accounts Receivable team. Applicants must have demonstrated understanding of AP and AR. Candidate will be responsible for cash receipts reconciliation, desktop deposits, and processing incoming payments for all departments in the State Bar. Candidate will be responsible for various billing and collections activities including posting licensee bar dues and processing incoming discipline payments. In addition, candidate will be responsible for AR unclaimed property. Experience with Oracle Fusion, Wells Fargo CEO Portal, and excel is helpful. This hybrid role can allow for up to two days of remote work per week depending on business need.
DEFINITION
The Fiscal Services Specialist is responsible for performing a variety of finance and budgeting functions and transactions including but not limited to preparing, processing, analyzing, interpreting, reconciling, maintaining and verifying the correctness of a variety of finance and budgeting data, records and reports related to accounts payable, accounts receivable, disbursement, member billing, payroll, attorney/client trust accounts, collection, budgeting, and financial reporting activities; responds to inquiries from State Bar members, employees and outside agencies, including vendors, tax authorities and banks. The Fiscal Services Specialist also provides support for other accounting and administrative functions within the Office of Finance and may be assigned to one or more specialized area.

Title: Senior Institutional Investment Operations Specialist
Job_Description:
About this role:

The Corporate Model Risk Group (CMoR) is seeking an experienced Lead Quantitative Analytics Specialist to join its model validation team. Our diverse lines of business offer a world of opportunity to expand your capabilities and advance your career. We invest in our people and provide a supportive environment in which to learn and grow.

CMoR is responsible for independently overseeing the management of model risk exposures and the quality of model risk management practices across the company. Market risk models are used to measure the risk of possible economic loss from adverse changes in market risk factors such as interest rates, credit spreads, foreign exchange rates, and equity and commodity prices, as well as mortgage rates and market liquidity dynamics. Market risk includes, but is not limited to, the risk of economic loss associated with price risk in the trading book, fair-value price risk of available-for-sale (AFS) securities and held-for-sale (HFS) assets, hedge-effectiveness risk associated with the mortgage book, and impairment on private equity investments.

This highly visibly position will provide interaction with various key model stakeholders and therefore requires someone with the ability to develop and maintain strong strategic partnerships. The ability to communicate with different audiences (technical staff, senior management, regulators) both verbally and in writing is very important. The team operates in a fast paced environment and the ability to multi-task and meet strict timelines is critical.

Title: Senior Institutional Investment Operations Specialist
Job_Description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco
While the SF Fed is a Reserve Bank, were not what you might expect. Were unreserved here. That means we seek new and diverse perspectives. We spark conversations and encourage debate. We build opportunity. We pursue careers that are true to ourselves. We are looking for people who want to help our country reach its full economic potential. When you join the SF Fed, you join a team of people working together to promote an inclusive economy that works for everyone.

At the SF Fed, we believe in the diversity of our people, ideas, and experiences and are committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve. The SF Fed is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Do you have a passion for bank supervision, risk management, audit, and controls? We welcome those Sr. Risk professionals seeking to join our premier public service organization. If this is you, please read about this exciting opportunity!

Group Overview

The Supervision + Credit group is responsible for the supervision and regulation of state member banks (SMBs), bank holding companies, savings and loan holding companies, financial holding companies, data service providers, trust companies, and foreign banking organizations that operate in the Twelfth District. Supervised institutions are in all states of the District and range in size and complexity from small community organizations to some of the largest banking organizations in the country.

Department Overview

The Wells Fargo & Co. (WFC) Dedicated Supervisory Team (DST), which operates as part of the Federal Reserves Large Institution Supervision Coordinating Committee (LISCC) supervisory program covering the largest and most systemic financial institutions, has an opening for a Capital Markets Senior Risk Specialist. As a member of our team, you will lead the supervision of WFC capital markets-related activities, including market risk elements (e.g., corporate treasury governance and management of interest rate risk, investment securities, trading products, counterparty exposures, and data & reporting.) In addition, you will assess practices across WFCs three lines of defense: front line, independent risk management, and internal audit. The position will report to the WFC DST Capital Team Lead, with responsibility for ensuring that supervisory monitoring and examinations result in timely, credible, and well-supported assessments of firms capital planning practices and financial risk management and controls. You are expected to collaborate with other members of the DST, constituents within the Federal Reserve (FR) System, and fellow regulators.

Position Summary

At the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, we believe in fostering a culture that values the diversity of our people, ideas, and experiences. Are you interested in playing a lead role in supervising one of the largest and most systemic financial institutions in the U.S.? Are you interested in an exciting opportunity to use your capital markets expertise while working in a collaborative environment? If yes  then read on!
Full time
Regular
Yes
Bank Examination
First (United States of America)

Title: Senior Institutional Investment Operations Specialist
Job_Description:
Job Description
The Iowa Department of Public Health (IDPH) and Department of Human Services (DHS) merged on July 1, 2022, to form one agency, the Iowa Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). We are seeking a Psychiatric Security Specialist to join the team at the Civil Commitment Unit for Sex Offenders (CCUSO). This is a full-time opportunity with an available shift differential of $0.90 per hour for second shift and $1.00 per hour for third shift and a strong opportunity for advancement, growth and development. Affordable on-campus housing is available for employees.

The Psychiatric Security Specialist provides direct-care services of both a security and treatment nature at CCUSO. The team member in this position assists mental health staff and performs a wide range of security functions in creating a maximally therapeutic environment for the care and treatment of individuals with mental abnormalities and/or personality disorders who were convicted of a sex offense. Routine duties of the Psychiatric Security Specialist include but are not limited to supervision of various patient activities at the CCUSO facility, facilitation of psycho-educational group activities, documentation of patient behaviors, operation of the master control center and supervision of patients on medical trips outside the facility.

CCUSO provides a secure, long-term, and highly structured setting to treat sexual offenders who have served their prison terms, but, in a separate civil trial, have been found likely to reoffend. CCUSO has a 5-phase treatment program that includes groups and individual therapy, psycho-educational programming, physiological assessments, and transitional release. Patients may also be court ordered into the community through supervised release. Treatment is determined using the Risk-Need-Responsivity Model based on the principles of respect for the person, behavior is changeable, and services align with the individuals needs.
We have a great total compensation package, including:

For additional information on benefits click here (Download PDF reader).


CCUSO is located in Cherokee, Iowa, a city of approximately 5,000 set in the beautiful Little Sioux River Valley in Northwest Iowa. Enjoy fishing and canoeing on the Little Sioux River that winds through town, providing a backdrop to a well-developed parks and trails system. In addition, Cherokee has over 1,000 acres of land devoted to parks for things like camping, hiking, and horseback riding. Cherokee is the home of the first accredited museum and planetarium in Iowa, Sandford Museum and Planetarium, established in 1951. Cherokee may be the smallest town in the world to have its own symphony orchestra! This 60-member orchestra has been referred to as the best kept secret in Northwest Iowa.

Cherokee is home to Western Iowa Tech Community College and 1 hour or less from other educational institutions including Morningside College, Northwestern College, Buena Vista University, and Dordt College. This quintessential Iowa town is 1 hour from Sioux City and 2 hours from Omaha. It is also 2  hours from Des Moines, home to Wells Fargo Arena (a host site of NCAA Basketball and premier concerts), as well as Lauridsen Skatepark, the nations largest public skate venue. Additionally, Des Moines has one of the nations finest State Fairs and is home to professional sports teams the Iowa Cubs, Iowa Wolves, Iowa Barnstormers and Iowa Wild. Check out these 10 Reasons to Move to Iowa.


HHS values those with lived experience and encourages foster youth, foster parents, and/or parents who were in the HHS system to apply. Minorities, women, veterans and persons with disabilities are also encouraged to apply (Hearing and Speech Impaired  Relay Iowa 1-800-735-2942 TDD).

Title: Lead Analytics Consultant - Enterprise Analytics And Data Science Team
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking several Lead Analytics Consultants to join the Enterprise Analytics and Data Science teams.

The first role available is within the Business Intelligence Team. EADS' Business Intelligence (EADS BI) team consults companywide on data exploration and visualization best practices, and provides BI/analytic services within DMI which includes developing and maintaining Tableau and PowerBI solutions that support DMI programs and services. EADS BI looks to solve interesting business problems through data exploration and visualization; navigating business partner through their data story. As a member of the team, you will engage directly with diverse business teams and use your analytic expertise to build/partner on new solutions, dashboards as well as enhancing current workstream solutions.

The second role available is within the Climate Initiative Analytics (CIA) Team. The CIA team works across the enterprise on their analytic and model needs to meet the Enterprise Climate goals of being Net Zero on emissions by 2050, investing $500B in Sustainable Financing and embedding Climate risk into our business decision making. As a member of the team, you will engage directly with the climate workstreams and use your analytic expertise to build/partner on new solutions, dashboards as well as enhancing current workstream solutions with an eye to reducing operational risk. The Climate space is new and evolving rapidly resulting in a dynamic, fast paced and unstructured environment, having a flexible mindset and the ability to find a path through the chaos will result in a highly rewarding experience.

The third role is within the Metrics Solutions Team, a newly formed function within Enterprise Analytics & Data Science, that works directly with operating teams to identify, enable, and operationalize metrics. The pod-based delivery model brings together consulting, lean process, visualization, and data transformation expertise to deliver custom solutions and consulting engagements that enable teams to run their business by the numbers. The work is fast-paced, challenging, and diverse, and provides experience to a mix of tools and solutioning techniques as well as exposure across the CAO organization.

As a lead analytics consultant, you will contribute to all phases of the engagement - from discovery to user requirements gathering to the design, development, and implementation of solutions-the primary responsibility will be to lead the build of effective solutions in Python and/or SQL.
