Title: Lead Analytics Consultant - Enterprise Analytics And Data Science Team
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Quantitative Analytics Associate within its Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) Center of Excellence team.

As part of our CoE, we invest in you and your career. In addition to Wells Fargo benefits you may be eligible for, you'll have access to elite training platforms like O'Reilly and DataCamp, where you can learn from industry leading experts, along with many other internal and external subject specific education opportunities. Our diverse data science team ranges from university professors and experienced practitioners to data scientists new to the industry, creating a full spectrum of thought leadership and solution design. You'll be part of a team where there is room to grow, learn, contribute and participate in work being done on world class distributed computing platforms with the latest AI ML framework, both Open Source and licensed, that ultimately supports our customers and company. The AI ML CoE also gives you the opportunity to share your passion for data science through peer education and contributing to programs designed to make the practice more approachable, including one for experienced professionals moving into data science roles.

Title: Lead Analytics Consultant - Enterprise Analytics And Data Science Team
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Quantitative Analytics Specialist within its Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning (ML) Center of Excellence group.

The AI and ML CoE team in Enterprise Analytics and Data Science (EADS) is responsible for developing and deploying NLP, machine learning, and AI solutions for key strategic Enterprise initiatives such as customer experience improvement, risk management and compliance, business operational excellence, and team member experience. The team is looking for an experienced analytics professional to add to its AI/ML/NLP model development team for Internal Audit.

As part of the AI/ML/NLP data science team for Internal Audit model development, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing AI/ML models focusing on Internal Audit initiatives for the enterprise and Wells Fargo lines of business. You will be leveraging unstructured text such as emails, text messages, notes, and semi-structured data in combination of structured data to apply text analytics and AI/NLP/ML techniques. You will use open stack programming languages (primarily Python) and/or vendor solutions to develop models and deploy them on Wells Fargo's AI platform. The ideal candidate should be able to think outside the box to uncover new ways to analyze unstructured data in conjunction with analytical tools to answer complicated business questions. As part of the model development team, you will be responsible of delivering solutions that meet business needs as well as any efforts related to model documentation and reviews to ensure the modeling processes and procedures meet corporate model risk policies and requirements.

Title: Lead Analytics Consultant - Enterprise Analytics And Data Science Team
Job_Description:
Title: Senior Data Analyst
Location: Charlotte, NC, Minneapolis, MN and Des Moines, IA
Duration: 6 months
Benefits on offer for this contract position: Health Insurance, Life insurance, 401K and Voluntary Benefits

Summary:
Lead support functions or operations for multiple business groups and contribute to large scale strategic initiatives. Ensure efficiency, quality, cost effectiveness of solutions, and pipeline management relating to assigned operations. Research moderately complex business, operational, and strategic initiatives that require analytical skills, basic knowledge of organizational strategy and Business Execution, and understanding of international business. Work independently to make recommendations for support function by providing support and leadership. Assist in the planning and execution of a variety of programs and initiatives that may include risk mitigation, efficiency, and customer experience. Collaborate and consult with team leaders in developing project plans, policies and procedures. Provide leadership in management of relationships and implementation of programs, services, and initiatives with cross functional business partners.

Title: Lead Analytics Consultant - Enterprise Analytics And Data Science Team
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Quantitative Analytics Specialist within its Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning (ML) Center of Excellence group.

The AI and ML CoE team in Enterprise Analytics and Data Science (EADS) is responsible for developing and deploying NLP, machine learning, and AI solutions for key strategic Enterprise initiatives such as customer experience improvement, risk management and compliance, business operational excellence, and team member experience. The team is looking for an experienced analytics professional to add to its AI/ML/NLP model development team for Internal Audit.

As part of the AI/ML/NLP data science team for Internal Audit model development, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing AI/ML models focusing on Internal Audit initiatives for the enterprise and Wells Fargo lines of business. You will be leveraging unstructured text such as emails, text messages, notes, and semi-structured data in combination of structured data to apply text analytics and AI/NLP/ML techniques. You will use open stack programming languages (primarily Python) and/or vendor solutions to develop models and deploy them on Wells Fargo's AI platform. The ideal candidate should be able to think outside the box to uncover new ways to analyze unstructured data in conjunction with analytical tools to answer complicated business questions. As part of the model development team, you will be responsible of delivering solutions that meet business needs as well as any efforts related to model documentation and reviews to ensure the modeling processes and procedures meet corporate model risk policies and requirements.

Title: Lead Analytics Consultant - Enterprise Analytics And Data Science Team
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Quantitative Analytics Associate within its Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) Center of Excellence team.

As part of our CoE, we invest in you and your career. In addition to Wells Fargo benefits you may be eligible for, you'll have access to elite training platforms like O'Reilly and DataCamp, where you can learn from industry leading experts, along with many other internal and external subject specific education opportunities. Our diverse data science team ranges from university professors and experienced practitioners to data scientists new to the industry, creating a full spectrum of thought leadership and solution design. You'll be part of a team where there is room to grow, learn, contribute and participate in work being done on world class distributed computing platforms with the latest AI ML framework, both Open Source and licensed, that ultimately supports our customers and company. The AI ML CoE also gives you the opportunity to share your passion for data science through peer education and contributing to programs designed to make the practice more approachable, including one for experienced professionals moving into data science roles.

Title: Lead Analytics Consultant - Enterprise Analytics And Data Science Team
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking several Lead Analytics Consultants to join the Enterprise Analytics and Data Science teams.

The first role available is within the Business Intelligence Team. EADS' Business Intelligence (EADS BI) team consults companywide on data exploration and visualization best practices, and provides BI/analytic services within DMI which includes developing and maintaining Tableau and PowerBI solutions that support DMI programs and services. EADS BI looks to solve interesting business problems through data exploration and visualization; navigating business partner through their data story. As a member of the team, you will engage directly with diverse business teams and use your analytic expertise to build/partner on new solutions, dashboards as well as enhancing current workstream solutions.

The second role available is within the Climate Initiative Analytics (CIA) Team. The CIA team works across the enterprise on their analytic and model needs to meet the Enterprise Climate goals of being Net Zero on emissions by 2050, investing $500B in Sustainable Financing and embedding Climate risk into our business decision making. As a member of the team, you will engage directly with the climate workstreams and use your analytic expertise to build/partner on new solutions, dashboards as well as enhancing current workstream solutions with an eye to reducing operational risk. The Climate space is new and evolving rapidly resulting in a dynamic, fast paced and unstructured environment, having a flexible mindset and the ability to find a path through the chaos will result in a highly rewarding experience.

The third role is within the Metrics Solutions Team, a newly formed function within Enterprise Analytics & Data Science, that works directly with operating teams to identify, enable, and operationalize metrics. The pod-based delivery model brings together consulting, lean process, visualization, and data transformation expertise to deliver custom solutions and consulting engagements that enable teams to run their business by the numbers. The work is fast-paced, challenging, and diverse, and provides experience to a mix of tools and solutioning techniques as well as exposure across the CAO organization.

As a lead analytics consultant, you will contribute to all phases of the engagement - from discovery to user requirements gathering to the design, development, and implementation of solutions-the primary responsibility will be to lead the build of effective solutions in Python and/or SQL.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a hands on Modern Engineering Lead Agile Coach to be a part of the Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) Transformation team. This dynamic team is in charge of agile transformation across 4,000+ global EFT resources.

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Finance, Human Resources, Risk, Audit and stakeholder relation business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

The Modern Engineering Lead Agile Coach role is a key position within the EFT Transformation team providing coaching support and thought leadership to help drive transformative change through the adoption of agile and DevOps practices. We are seeking a highly motivated individual to enable our transformation and modernization journey. This is a great opportunity for someone who has a passion for teaching and mentoring technical teams on cutting-edge technologies and techniques, enabling teams to be their best, to put the customer at the center of everything we do, and to have fun while we do it.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Automation Infrastructure Engineer with deep technical knowledge who will work closely with software and systems engineers in a collaborative agile team environment to ensure quality service delivery to the Wells Fargo supported applications, systems and software solutions teams.

This role will be responsible to automate the provisioning of a rack of servers from the configuration of the hardware to the installation of the operating system. This position will build automation to reduce the need for manual tasks, and producing status / health reporting metrics that reflect the operational health of our applications, tools, and testing efforts. We are looking for a highly motivated individual who is looking to join our team and can thrive in our fast-paced and agile team environment.

The successful candidate will have a proven track record of automation.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking is seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer within the Enterprise Database Management (EDM) team to lead the team's efforts in the design, development, automated testing, implementation, and adoption of products to drive the delivery of applications, microservices, private cloud, SQL statements, messaging, scheduling, and database infrastructure in support of our Database Compliance & Risk project initiatives.

As a member of our team, you will launch new code builds and Continuous Delivery and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) deployments utilizing Jenkins and GitHub repositories while using Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF) to pursue additional Kubernetes container and orchestration solutions for hosting new application components.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a DevOps Engineer who can work closely with application development teams to onboard sunrise applications and maintain daily operational requirements for an enterprise-wide effort. Additionally, this individual will be expected to provide guidance for junior DevOps Engineers and function as an escalation point for challenges that are unable to be resolved quickly by those same junior engineers.

DevOps Engineers are responsible for interfacing with the application development teams to assist them in determining the most efficient and value-added method of automating their application Lifecycle development activities that move their applications through the process to implementation. In addition, to these consultative activities, the DevOps Engineer will work with the application teams, technology partners, and all relevant teams to on-board the application team and their applications into the DevOps automation service. They will lead on-board efforts and matrix teams of automation engineers. An engineer may also assume duties and roles related to Software Configuration Management and/or Development. In this capacity, they will work with version control systems, automated build systems, regression test systems along with many other Lifecycle tools. They will develop, architect, integrate and support the integrated system and components.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a hands on Modern Engineering Lead Agile Coach to be a part of the Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) Transformation team. This dynamic team is in charge of agile transformation across 4,000+ global EFT resources.

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Finance, Human Resources, Risk, Audit and stakeholder relation business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

The Modern Engineering Lead Agile Coach role is a key position within the EFT Transformation team providing coaching support and thought leadership to help drive transformative change through the adoption of agile and DevOps practices. We are seeking a highly motivated individual to enable our transformation and modernization journey. This is a great opportunity for someone who has a passion for teaching and mentoring technical teams on cutting-edge technologies and techniques, enabling teams to be their best, to put the customer at the center of everything we do, and to have fun while we do it.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Principal Engineer, DevOps Operations for the Technology Architecture and Engineering Group as a part of Wells Fargo Technology. Learn more about career areas and current lines of business at www.wellsfargojobs.com

Wells Fargo Technology is driven by our customers' desire for resilient, efficient, effective, decisive, and responsive technology. To support those needs, the Chief Technology Office (CTO) optimizes the engineering experience by streamlining and offering consumable, cloud-based, certified automation across the engineering life cycle. CTO creates, publishes, and enforces architectural standards and development frameworks, and supports the adoption of cloud and Agile. The CTO organization is comprised of the following teams: Agile Transformation, Enterprise Architecture (EA), Application Hosting Services (EAS), Enterprise Services & Portfolio Management (ESPM), Technology Enablement & Pipeline (TE&P), Operations & Site Reliability Engineering, and Business Services & Governance. The Technology Enablement & Pipeline (TE&P) team within CTO is responsible for product ownership, delivery, and operational support of the Enterprise Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) Pipeline (EPL). Our strategy focuses on building a fully automated (build, deploy, and test), end-to-end pipeline that includes a community driven inner source model, establishes self-service onboarding capabilities, and integrates software development lifecycle and segregation of duties controls. This Principal Engineer within the TE&P team will work across the EPL Product Owners, Engineering and Operations teams to identify and implement solutions that advance our strategy. As a key engineering leader across the TE&P team, they will also collaborate with Wells Fargo Technology teams that use the EPL and key stakeholders to assess product gaps and ensure identification and delivery of product offerings that achieve desired business value and key outcomes and enable continued adoption of the EPL. With expertise in site reliability engineering, they will analyze the EPL and own and implement appropriate practices and solutions to continuously improve the reliability of the EPL.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking is seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer within the Enterprise Database Management (EDM) team to lead the team's efforts in the design, development, automated testing, implementation, and adoption of products to drive the delivery of applications, microservices, private cloud, SQL statements, messaging, scheduling, and database infrastructure in support of our Database Compliance & Risk project initiatives.

As a member of our team, you will launch new code builds and Continuous Delivery and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) deployments utilizing Jenkins and GitHub repositories while using Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF) to pursue additional Kubernetes container and orchestration solutions for hosting new application components.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a hands on Modern Engineering Lead Agile Coach to be a part of the Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) Transformation team. This dynamic team is in charge of agile transformation across 4,000+ global EFT resources.

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Finance, Human Resources, Risk, Audit and stakeholder relation business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

The Modern Engineering Lead Agile Coach role is a key position within the EFT Transformation team providing coaching support and thought leadership to help drive transformative change through the adoption of agile and DevOps practices. We are seeking a highly motivated individual to enable our transformation and modernization journey. This is a great opportunity for someone who has a passion for teaching and mentoring technical teams on cutting-edge technologies and techniques, enabling teams to be their best, to put the customer at the center of everything we do, and to have fun while we do it.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Automation Infrastructure Engineer with deep technical knowledge who will work closely with software and systems engineers in a collaborative agile team environment to ensure quality service delivery to the Wells Fargo supported applications, systems and software solutions teams.

This role will be responsible to automate the provisioning of a rack of servers from the configuration of the hardware to the installation of the operating system. This position will build automation to reduce the need for manual tasks, and producing status / health reporting metrics that reflect the operational health of our applications, tools, and testing efforts. Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Principal Engineer in Technology Architecture and Engineering as part of Technology. Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com

Wells Fargo Technology is driven by our customers' desire for resilient, efficient, effective, decisive, and responsive technology. To support those needs, the Chief Technology Office (CTO) optimizes the engineering experience by streamlining and offering consumable, cloud-based, certified automation across the engineering life cycle. CTO creates, publishes, and enforces architectural standards and development frameworks, and supports the adoption of cloud and Agile. The CTO organization is comprised of the following teams: Agile Transformation, Enterprise Architecture (EA), Application Hosting Services (EAS), Enterprise Services & Portfolio Management (ESPM), Technology Enablement & Pipeline (TE&P), Operations & Site Reliability Engineering, and Business Services & Governance.

The Technology Enablement & Pipeline (TE&P) team within CTO is responsible for product ownership, delivery, and operational support of the Enterprise Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) Pipeline (EPL). Our strategy focuses on building a fully automated (build, deploy, and test), end-to-end pipeline that includes a community driven inner source model, establishes self-service onboarding capabilities, and integrates software development lifecycle and segregation of duties controls.

This Principal Engineer within the TE&P team will work across the EPL Product Owners, Engineering and Operations teams to identify and implement solutions that advance our strategy. As a key engineering leader across the TE&P team, they will also collaborate with Wells Fargo Technology teams that use the EPL and key stakeholders to assess product gaps and ensure identification and delivery of product offerings that achieve desired business value and key outcomes and enable continued adoption of the EPL. With expertise in site reliability engineering, they will analyze the EPL and own and implement appropriate practices and solutions to continuously improve the reliability of the EPL.

Title: Lead Agile Coach: DevOps/Modern Engineering Coach
Job_Description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Systems Operations Engineer as part of the Chief Technology Office (CTO), the Technology Enablement & Pipeline organization has a key responsibility for the Enterprise Pipeline and its Operational Support, across all applications in the Wells Fargo Enterprise.

This opportunity is available for a motivated and experienced Lead DevOps Engineer who can work closely with application development teams to onboard sunrise applications and maintain daily operational requirements for an enterprise-wide effort. Additionally, this individual will be expected to provide guidance for junior DevOps Engineers and function as an escalation point for challenges that are unable to be resolved quickly by those same junior engineers.

Lead DevOps Systems Operations Engineers are responsible for interfacing with the application development teams to assist them in determining the most efficient and value-added method of automating their application lifecycle development activities that move their applications through the process to implementation. In addition, to these consultative activities, the DevOps Engineer will work with the application teams, technology partners, and all relevant teams to on-board the application team and their applications into the DevOps automation service. They will lead on-board efforts and matrix teams of automation engineers. An engineer may also assume duties and roles related to Software Configuration Management and/or Development. In this capacity, they will work with version control systems, automated build systems, regression test systems along with many other Lifecycle tools. They will develop, architect, integrate and support the integrated system and components.

550 South 4th St - Minneapolis, MN

Job_Description:
In this role, you will:
Work with cross functional teams to identify, strategize, and execute Artificial Intelligence initiatives focused around Fraud Mgmt.

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Wells Fargo Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure footprint; provides information security; and enables continuous banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels to Wells Fargo's more than 70 million global customers.

Wells Fargo Bank N.A. seeks a Lead Data Engineer in Charlotte, NC.

:

Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., is hiring a Lead Data Engineer to lead complex initiatives with broad impact and act as key participant in large scale software planning for the Technology area; Design, develop, and run tooling to discover problems in data and applications and report the issues to engineering and product leadership; Review and analyze complex software enhancement initiatives for business, operational or technical improvements that require in depth evaluation of multiple factors including intangibles or unprecedented factors; Make decisions in complex and multi-faceted data engineering situations requiring understanding of software package options and programming language and compliance requirements that influence and lead Technology to meet deliverables and drive organizational change; and Strategically collaborate and consult with internal partners to resolve highly risky data engineering challenges.

None

:

Job Description

About this role:

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Enterprise Service Management (ESM) team is a new organization in EFT which represents the integration of the ServiceNow delivery team, IT data, and Governance to provide an unmatched, industry-leading experience for customers and employees alike. Title: ServiceNow Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

The Enterprise Functions Technology (EFT) group provides technology solutions and support for Risk, Audit, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Corporate Properties, and Stakeholder Relations business lines. In addition, EFT provides unique technology solutions and innovation for Wells Fargo Technology, Enterprise Shared Services, and Enterprise Data Management. This combined portfolio of applications and tools are continually engineered to meet the challenges of stability, security, scalability, and speed.

Within EFT the Corporate Risk Technology group helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas: credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.

We are seeking a Senior Data Integration Developer (Senior Software Engineer) to be part of a team that provides reporting data warehouse solutions for Risk and Compliance across all levels of the organization. This position will use their strong understanding of data management, how to design and build dimensional data models, and overall delivery of data integration solutions. This position will partner with Data Modelers, report developers, and Business Intelligence Analysts to design/develop/deploy information solutions in the enterprise risk domain.

Title: ServiceNow Lead Data Engineer
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Principal Engineer to be part of the Hybrid Cloud Data Ecosystem team supporting our Cyber Security Data Science and Analytics function. The team is continually advancing state-of-the-art technologies and solutions to solve a wide range of complex data management and analytics problems.

This position will be working in a highly collaborative environment together with the business, technologists and control partners to deploy solutions into production. Working on data intensive use cases operating on highly scalable (multi-petabytes) data, and focused on investing independent time towards learning, researching and experimenting with new innovations in the field.

Our work spans across all domains of Cyber Security. With this unparalleled access to the firm, the role offers a unique opportunity to explore novel and complex challenges that could profoundly transform how the bank operates. This is a critical role working very directly with the Head of Wells Fargo's Cyber Security Data Ecosystem and singularly providing architecture and engineering direction to all of the ecosystem engineering teams.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Information Security Engineer for the Enterprise Data Masking Team

In this role, you will:
Lead or participate in onboarding internal applications to the Delphix data masking engines and creation of the environments and algorithms
Partner with our engagement team, and operations support teams to ensure masking jobs are completed in timely manner, and resolve issues during testing

Title: Senior EDLP Data at Rest Response Analyst
Job_Description:
About this role:

The Enterprise Data Loss Prevention (EDLP) Data at Rest Response Team Senior Analyst is a key role supporting the team's mission to prevent inappropriate storage, external sharing and distribution of sensitive company, customer and employee information. Responsibilities include, but aren't limited to:

Rapidly validating potential risks associated with Data at Rest DLP events and taking action to prevent further undesirable behaviors.
Collaborating with file store owners and front line management to help prevent future repeat scenarios.
Collaborating with multiple internal partner organizations to refer certain events requiring additional investigation or preventive measures.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship

Job_Description:
About this role:

The Enterprise Data Loss Prevention (EDLP) Data at Rest Response Team Senior Analyst is a key role supporting the team's mission to prevent inappropriate storage, external sharing and distribution of sensitive company, customer and employee information. Responsibilities include, but aren't limited to:

Rapidly validating potential risks associated with Data at Rest DLP events and taking action to prevent further undesirable behaviors.
Collaborating with file store owners and front line management to help prevent future repeat scenarios.
Collaborating with multiple internal partner organizations to refer certain events requiring additional investigation or preventive measures.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship


$100,800.00 - $179,200.00 Annual


At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Senior EDLP Data at Rest Response Analyst
Job_Description:
About this Role:

At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people with financial acumen who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.

Finance brings together enterprise functions that drive Wells Fargo's financial management, including accounting and control, financial planning and analysis, line of business finance, asset-liability management, treasury, tax, management, and the company's investment portfolios. They also inform shareholders, regulators, taxing authorities, employees, and leaders of the company's financial performance through earning releases, investor meetings, and meetings with regulators and credit rating agencies, following appropriate reporting guidelines.

Wells Fargo Technology Enablement Functions Finance supports nearly $4 Billion of the firm's technology budget. This highly visible role will have ownership and accountability for all Technology Financial Management activities in support of the division's financial planning and analysis team. This includes coordination of all financial planning deliverables, oversight and quality management of monthly forecasting and month-end close processes (e.g., accruals, journals, headcount ramp plans, resource planning, investment analysis, and vendor expense updates), and annual planning activities.

The Finance Lead Consultant will be a strategic thinker and partner to the Technology finance teams and Chiefs of Staff with day-to-day responsibilities focused on process improvement, transformation, and tool adoption. Additionally, the Finance Lead will have responsibilities to organize planning processes and coordinate and compile investment book of work (BOW) expense planning and business case development in collaboration with Technology and LOB counterparts.

Strong analytical abilities with knowledge of financial systems and related process workflows with the ability to simplify/analyze large data sets in order to tell the story behind the financials and prepare creative and intuitive presentations will be critical for this role.

The Position



A mature leader with proven financial acumen, critical thinking skills, and demonstrated senior operational credibility will be determining factors in the selection. Successful candidates will be articulate, strategic, and possess a demonstrated leadership capability. The role requires a sense of urgency, passion for results, and personal accountability for driving results, including:
This role will partner with the senior business leaders and financial analytics team to provide leaders and executives with an understanding of investments, productivity, future forecasting, deeper analysis, business growth and financial returns. The candidate will use their strong financial acumen and financial skills to perform complex analysis. Additionally, there is a need for a role that requires a more seasoned presence and advanced collaboration and communication skills in additional to the core analytical capabilities to support data-driven decision making based on critical analysis in areas such as expense management, allocations, budgeting, vendor contracts, procurement, rate analysis, investments, and efficiency initiatives.



Reporting into the Senior Finance Manager for Technology Enablement Functions Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), the Finance Lead Consultant will have responsibilities for the following:




Conduct ad-hoc analysis and recommendations supporting improvement opportunities (e.g., streamlining processes and reporting, financial and headcount trends, etc.)










5+ years experience in Financial Acumen, Analytics, and Business Process

5+ years experience in financial management supporting large-scale organizations








Desired Qualifications


About this Role:

Wells Fargo Technology Enablement Functions Finance supports nearly $4 Billion of the firm's technology budget. This highly visible role will have ownership and accountability for all Technology Financial Management activities in support of the division's financial planning and analysis team. This includes coordination of all financial planning deliverables, oversight and quality management of monthly forecasting and month-end close processes (e.g., accruals, journals, headcount ramp plans, resource planning, investment analysis, and vendor expense updates), and annual planning activities.

The Lead Finance Lead Analyst will be a strategic thinker and partner to the Technology finance teams and Chiefs of Staff with day-to-day responsibilities focused on process improvement, transformation, and tool adoption. Additionally, the Finance Lead will have responsibilities to organize planning processes and coordinate and compile investment book of work (BOW) expense planning and business case development in collaboration with Technology and LOB counterparts.

Strong analytical abilities with knowledge of financial systems and related process workflows with the ability to simplify/analyze large data sets in order to tell the story behind the financials and prepare creative and intuitive presentations will be critical for this role.

The Position

The Candidate

A mature leader with proven financial acumen, critical thinking skills, and demonstrated senior operational credibility will be determining factors in the selection. Successful candidates will be articulate, strategic, and possess a demonstrated leadership capability. The role requires a sense of urgency, passion for results, and personal accountability for driving results, including:

Leadership/ Transformational Change Agent: Proven ability to establish and gain buy-in for ideas/ vision/ define solutions that are attainable and directly support business goals. Garner enthusiastic support across the organization to accomplish business goals and solutions.

Problem Solving: Ability to visualize, articulate, and solve problems. Accurately analyze complex issues, ensuring identification of underlying root causes. Demonstrates the ability to solve problems under conditions of uncertainty and ambiguity. Generates alternative solutions and expertly handles obstacles.

Professional Skills: Capable prolific communicator that is comfortable working with a wide variety of corporate executives, operations, customers and business partners. Proven teamwork skills, excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.

Creativity and Innovation: Able to think creatively and critically to identify opportunities to uniquely and effectively meet customer needs. Strong ability to assess market and competitiveness conditions and to develop creative, break-through approaches supporting improved customer experiences and operation efficiencies.

Analytical Thinking/ Financial Acumen: Obtains and uses financial data necessary to identify opportunities and understand problems. Uses quantitative techniques to make it actionable. Able to analyze data and turn it into insightful information through financial acumen and to communication solutions to various levels.

This role will partner with the senior business leaders and financial analytics team to provide leaders and executives with an understanding of investments, productivity, future forecasting, deeper analysis, business growth and financial returns. The candidate will use their strong financial acumen and financial skills to perform complex analysis. Additionally, there is a need for a role that requires a more seasoned presence and advanced collaboration and communication skills in additional to the core analytical capabilities to support data-driven decision making based on critical analysis in areas such as expense management, allocations, budgeting, vendor contracts, procurement, rate analysis, investments, and efficiency initiatives.

Responsibilities

Reporting into the Senior Finance Manager for Technology Enablement Functions Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), the Lead Finance Analyst will have responsibilities for the following:




Conduct ad-hoc analysis and recommendations supporting improvement opportunities (e.g., streamlining processes and reporting, financial and headcount trends, etc.)








$111,100.00 - $197,500.00 Annual

Title: Senior EDLP Data at Rest Response Analyst
Job_Description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Data Management Analyst as part of the CIB Business Enablement team covering Markets Regulation and International (Corporate and Investment Banking). This team is part of the Data Strategy, Business Enablement and Remediation organization for CIB Data Domain, within CIB Infrastructure Services. This role is hybrid, located in office 3 days per week, and ability to work remote 2 days per week.

The CIB Business Enablement team supports CIB initiatives by providing data strategy, business consulting, and business solutions. The team is required to enable and support multiple business-sponsored multi-year transformation initiatives and regulatory efforts, as well as provide dedicated capital markets subject matter expertise to solve enterprise data issues. As a member of the team, you will deliver business solutions in the areas of CIB Regulatory Reporting, and CIB International, with the Traded Products Domain Authorized Provisioning Point (TPD APP) as one of the firm's strategic data sources.

The Lead Data Management Analyst will work collaboratively with members of CIB Markets , International (Finance, Risk), various Wells Fargo international entities, Front Line Risk and Control, CIB Operations, and other teams to identify, articulate, and deliver solutions that enable key business initiatives and/or mitigate risk. The successful candidate will have a broad and solid understanding of the Corporate & Investment Banking business, its Data Domain, and is passionate about leading transformational change.

This role requires advanced relationship and communication skills as you will partner with three key areas: Data clients - downstream consumers and their tech teams; data product owners - APP product teams and their tech teams; and data suppliers - LoBs and their upstream systems of record/SoRs.



Charlotte, NC: 550 S Tryon

New York, NY: 30 Hudson Yards



Charlotte, NC: $96,600 - $171,800

New York, NY: $115,900 - $206,100


$96,600.00 - $171,800.00 Annual

Title: Senior EDLP Data at Rest Response Analyst
Job_Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Data Management Analyst...

The Enterprise Data Platforms Lead Data Management Analyst role will report to the EDL Governance Operations Manager as a key member of the team charged with managing data security and privacy operations through a business data management lens across the EDP-owned business processes. This position will be accountable for the support and execution of daily EDP governance processes and procedures that can include: execution of end-to-end data scanning, data access business processes; and business controls relating to data privacy & sensitivity, data onboarding, and data protection. Provide consultation in process evaluations, performance monitoring, and statistics to senior management. Will lead/participate in analysis of complex multi domain remediation efforts and serve as a single point of contact on low to medium priority issues. This challenging yet rewarding role will require collaboration across other enterprise data management teams as well as developing strong working partnerships with Wells Fargo Technology teams.
